high_consensus.description: Gate failure handling: explicit actions when quality gates fail, stop-the-line rule for Redis audit spike
high_consensus.integration: Added Gate Failure Handling section with per-sprint gate triggers and actions, plus stop-the-line rule referencing SDD §3.3 / Flatline SKP-010

high_consensus.description: Sprint capacity/duration: missing sprint-level time estimates for single-engineer execution
high_consensus.integration: Added Duration column to sprint overview table (2-3d, 2d, 1-2d) with total estimate of 5-7 working days

high_consensus.description: E2E workspace project definition: vitest.workspace.ts should include explicit e2e project alongside unit and integration
high_consensus.integration: Added e2e project definition (includes *.e2e.test.ts, root tests/e2e/) to Task 1.1 vitest.workspace.ts AC

disputed.description: Import guard transitive imports — static guard only catches direct redis/ioredis imports, not transitive through project modules
disputed.rationale: Added note to Task 1.5 that transitive imports are covered by ECONNREFUSED runtime detection, not the static guard

blockers.concern: Stub becomes de facto product behavior — E2E stubs implementing JWKS health gate and claim validation create behavioral expectations that constrain production design
blockers.integration: Added stub behavior drift risk to Risk Assessment — test-only boundaries documented, production designed from requirements

blockers.concern: Redis mocking scope risk — 7-10 files with complex mocking needs could exceed sprint capacity without triggering >10 hard escalation threshold
blockers.integration: Added soft-escalation gap risk to Risk Assessment — flag at 7-10 complex mocks for capacity review

blockers.concern: Workspace test classification gaps — tests with non-standard naming or locations may fall through vitest workspace project definitions
blockers.integration: Added catch-all test project risk to Risk Assessment — warns on unclassified test files

blockers.concern: Docker env differences between local dev (Docker Desktop), CI (GitHub Actions), and Linux — networking, DNS, volume behavior varies
blockers.integration: Added Docker env risk to Risk Assessment — minimum Docker 24+, Compose v2.20+ documented

blockers.concern: JWKS filesystem semantics — atomic mv visibility across Docker volume shared between containers depends on storage driver
blockers.integration: Added JWKS volume driver risk to Risk Assessment — overlay2 default, fuse-overlayfs check in preflight
